'''''sîr''''' means "river, stream" in [[Sindarin]] (and [[Noldorin]]).<ref name=LR/><ref>{{PE|17}}, p. 37</ref><ref name=App>{{S|Appendix}}, ''sîr''</ref>

==Etymology==
In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']], Noldorin ''sîr'' is a descendant form of [[Quenya]]/[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]] ''[[sír|sīre]]'' ("river"), deriving from [[Sundocarme|root]] [[SIR]] ("flow").<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 385</ref><ref>{{VT|46a}}, p. 13</ref>

==Examples==
*[[Gladden River#Etymology|'''''Sîr''''' ''Ninglor'']]
*[[Sirannon#Etymology|'''''Sir'''annon'']]
*[[Ossiriand#Etymology|''Os'''sir'''iand'']]
*[[Minhiriath#Etymology|''Min'''hir'''iath'']]
*[[Ethir Anduin#Etymology|''Et'''hir''' Anduin'']]
*[[Thorn Sir#Etymology|''Thorn '''Sir''''']]
*[[Nanduhirion#Etymology|''Nandu'''hir'''ion'']]
*''[[Sirion#Etymology|'''Sir'''ion]]''

==See also==
*[[Quenya]] ''[[sír]]'' ("river")
*[[Sindarin]] ''[[duin]]'' ("large river")
*[[Quenya]] ''[[-duinë]]''
